org.springframework.data.gemfire.repository.query

Class QueryString

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.data.gemfire.repository.query.QueryString
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PagedQueryString

    public class QueryString
extends java.lang.Object
    QueryString is a base class used to construct and model syntactically valid Apache Geode OQL query statements. QueryString uses Pattern based recognition and matching to parse and modify the OQL query statement. This is an internal class used by the SDG Repository infrastructure extension.
    See Also:
    Matcher, Pattern, Region, Sort, OqlKeyword, Repository

    • Constructor Detail

      • QueryString

        public QueryString(@NonNull
                   java.lang.String query)
        Constructs a new instance of QueryString initialized with the given OQL query.
        Parameters:
        query - String containing the OQL query.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if query is null or empty.
        See Also:
        validateQuery(String), String

      • QueryString

        public QueryString(@NonNull
                   java.lang.Class<?> domainType)
        Constructs a new instance of QueryString initialized with the given application domain model type used to construct an OQL SELECT query statement.
        Parameters:
        domainType - application domain model type to query; must not be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the application domain model type is null.
        See Also:
        QueryString(Class, boolean)

      • QueryString

        public QueryString(@NonNull
                   java.lang.Class<?> domainType,
                   boolean asCountQuery)
        Constructs a new instance of QueryString initialized with the given application domain model type, which is used to construct an OQL SELECT query statement. asCountQuery is a Boolean flag indicating whether to select a count or select the contents of the objects for the given applicatlion domain model type.
        Parameters:
        domainType - application domain model type to query; must not be null.
        asCountQuery - boolean value to indicate if this is a select count query.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the application domain model type is null.
        See Also:
        asQuery(Class, boolean), QueryString(String)

                             java.lang.String query)

        public static QueryString from(@NonNull
                               java.lang.Class<?> domainType)
        Factory method used to construct a new instance of QueryString initialized with the given application domain model type from which the OQL query will be created.
        Parameters:
        domainType - application domain model type for which the OQL query will be created.
        Returns:
        a new QueryString for the given application domain model type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if application domain model type is null.
        See Also:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a new count QueryString.
        Throws:

        See Also:

      • getDigitsOnly

        protected static java.lang.String getDigitsOnly(@Nullable
                                                java.lang.String value)
        Null-safe method used to extract digits from the given String value as a whole number.
        Parameters:
        value - String to evaluate.
        Returns:
        the digits extracted from the give String value as a whole number or an empty String if the given String is null, empty or contains no digits.
        See Also:
        String

      • isLimited

        public boolean isLimited()
        Determines whether a LIMIT is present in the OQL query.
        Returns:
        a boolean value determining whether a LIMIT is present in the OQL query.
        See Also:
        getLimit()

      • getInParameterIndexes

        public java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer> getInParameterIndexes()
        Returns the parameter indexes used in this query.
        Returns:
        the parameter indexes used in this query or an empty Iterable if no parameter indexes are used.
        See Also:
        Iterable

      • getLimit

        public int getLimit()
        Gets the LIMIT number. Use isLimited() to determine whether the OQL query statement has a LIMIT.
        Returns:
        an Integer value containing the LIMIT number or Integer.MAX_VALUE if the OQL query statement is not limited.
        See Also:
        isLimited()

      • getQuery

        @NonNull
protected java.lang.String getQuery()
        Returns the OQL query statement from which this QueryString was constructed.
        Returns:
        the OQL query; never null or empty.

      • adjustLimit

        public QueryString adjustLimit(@Nullable
                               java.lang.Integer limit)
        Null-safe method to adjust the LIMIT of the OQL query to use the new, given LIMIT.
        Parameters:
        limit - Integer value specifying the new query LIMIT.
        Returns:
        a new QueryString with the adjusted query LIMIT.
        See Also:
        withLimit(Integer)

      • asDistinct

        public QueryString asDistinct()
        Replaces an OQL SELECT query with an OQL SELECT DISTINCT query if the query is not already distinct; i.e. does not contain the DISTINCT OQL keyword.
        Returns:
        a SELECT DISTINCT query if the query does not contain the DISTINCT OQL keyword.
        See Also:
        asDistinct(String)

      • bindIn

        @NonNull
public QueryString bindIn(@NonNull
                                   java.util.Collection<?> values)
        Binds the given Collection of values into the first IN parameter of the OQL Query (String) by expanding the given values into a comma-separated list.
        Parameters:
        values - Collection of values to bind; must not be null or empty.
        Returns:
        a new QueryString having IN parameter bound with values or returns this QueryString if the Collection of values is null or empty.
        See Also:
        Collection

      • fromRegion

        public QueryString fromRegion(org.apache.geode.cache.Region<?,?> region,
                              java.lang.Class<?> domainType)
        Replaces the domain classes referenced inside the current query with the given Region.
        Parameters:
        region - Region to query; must not be null.
        domainType - type of the persistent entity to query; must not be null.
        Returns:
        a new QueryString with an OQL SELECT statement having a FROM clause based on the selected Region.
        See Also:
        Region, Class

      • fromRegion

        @Deprecated
public QueryString fromRegion(java.lang.Class<?> domainType,
                                          org.apache.geode.cache.Region<?,?> region)
        Deprecated. use fromRegion(Region, Class).

      • orderBy

        @NonNull
public QueryString orderBy(@Nullable
                                    org.springframework.data.domain.Sort sort)
        Appends the Sort order to this GemFire OQL Query string.
        Parameters:
        sort - Sort indicating the order of the query results.
        Returns:
        a new QueryString with an ORDER BY clause if Sort is not null, or this QueryString as-is if Sort is null.
        See Also:
        Sort, QueryString

      • withHints

        @NonNull
public QueryString withHints(@NonNull
                                      java.lang.String... hints)
        Applies HINTS to the OQL Query.
        Parameters:
        hints - array of Strings containing query hints.
        Returns:
        a new QueryString if hints are not null or empty, or return this QueryString.

      • withImport

        @NonNull
public QueryString withImport(@NonNull
                                       java.lang.String importExpression)
        Applies an IMPORT to the OQL Query.
        Parameters:
        importExpression - String containing the import clause.
        Returns:
        a new QueryString if an import was declared, or return this QueryString.

      • withLimit

        @NonNull
public QueryString withLimit(@NonNull
                                      java.lang.Integer limit)
        Applies a LIMIT to the OQL Query.
        Parameters:
        limit - Integer indicating the number of results to return from the query.
        Returns:
        a new QueryString if a limit was specified, or return this QueryString.

      • withTrace

        @NonNull
public QueryString withTrace()
        Applies TRACE logging to the OQL Query.
        Returns:
        a new QueryString with tracing enabled.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of this QueryString. Returns the complete OQL query statement.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String representation of this QueryString.
        See Also:
        Object.toString(), String
